x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
In long-term care (LTC) homes and community care settings, PSWs and nurses often rely on paper-based task boards, manual handoffs, and verbal instructions to manage resident care. This leads to:
Missed or delayed tasks Confusion during shift changes Inefficient coordination between staff Difficulty tracking accountability or task completion Digital task management is needed to streamline daily care activities, improve accountability, and ensure residents receive timely care.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ServiceNow products or capabilities used:

  • App Engine Studio – build the CareHub application, task tables, forms, and dashboards.
  • Flow Designer – automate task assignment, escalation, and notifications.
  • Service Portal / Mobile App – allow PSWs and nurses to view and update tasks on tablets or mobile devices.
  • Performance Analytics – track task completion, delays, and compliance trends.
  • IntegrationHub – optional integration with scheduling systems or resident databases.
  • Inbound / Outbound REST APIs – sync tasks with external care or facility management systems.
  • Notification & Event Management – push task alerts, reminders, and overdue notifications to staff.
  • Role-based Access Control (ACLs) – ensure only authorized staff can view or update tasks.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Technical dependencies:

  • Resident master data from an EHR or LTC database (via API or CSV import)
  • Staff directory or roster to assign tasks (via LDAP/Active Directory or ServiceNow user table)
  • Mobile devices or tablets for bedside staff access

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Anticipated challenges:

  • Ensuring staff adoption and training for digital task management
  • Keeping task lists synchronized during network interruptions or shift changes
  • Mapping variable care needs into standardized task templates
  • Integrating with multiple legacy systems across different LTC facilities
